summary: This is a notice of electronic filing from the U.S. District Court for the District of New Hampshire regarding a removal hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell held on July 2, 2020. The document records that Maxwell waived her identity hearing and that a detention hearing is to be held in the prosecuting district.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case USA v. Maxwell, who waived her identity hearing during a removal proceeding.

persons.name: Andrea K. Johnstone
persons.context: Presided over the removal hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Lawrence Vogelman
persons.context: Listed as the attorney for the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell, in the hearing.

persons.name: Susan Inateman
persons.context: Served as the court reporter for the removal hearing.

connections.description: Lawrence Vogelman is listed as the defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell in the court proceeding.
Magistrate Judge Andrea K. Johnstone presided over the removal hearing for defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Removal Hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A removal hearing was held for Ghislaine Maxwell before Magistrate Judge Andrea K. Johnstone. Maxwell waived her identity hearing, and it was determined a detention hearing would be held in the prosecuting district.

locations: U.S. District Court District of New Hampshire
keyFacts: A removal hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell was held on July 2, 2020.
Ghislaine Maxwell knowingly and voluntarily waived her right to an in-court identity hearing.
The detention hearing for Maxwell was deferred to be held in the prosecuting district.
The case is identified as USA v. Maxwell, case number 1:20-mj-00132.
